title: 4 Simple Ways to Change Your Location in Google Chrome

steps.title: Go to https://www.google.com/ in Chrome.
steps.content: Go to https://www.google.com/ in Chrome. You can change your region in Google's search settings. If you don't set the location yourself, it will automatically detect your location based on your IP address.

steps.title: Click Settings.
steps.content: Click Settings . This is at the very bottom of the page, next to Privacy and Terms . A pop-up menu will open.

steps.title: Click Search settings.
steps.content: Click Search settings . This is the first option.

steps.title: Click Other settings.
steps.content: Click Other settings . You can find this in the left panel.

steps.title: Click Language & region.
steps.content: Click Language & region . This is at the top of the page, under the Language header.

steps.title: Click Results region.
steps.content: Click Results region . This is the bottom option.

steps.title: Select a new region and click Confirm.
steps.content: Select a new region and click Confirm . You can scroll down to view the regions in alphabetical order or use the search bar. When you use Google Search , your results will be based on your new region.

steps.title: Click ⋮.
steps.content: Click ⋮ . This is in the top-right corner of the Google Chrome window.

steps.title: Click More tools.
steps.content: Click More tools . You can find this at the bottom of the pop-up menu.

steps.title: Click Developer tools.
steps.content: Click Developer tools . A new window will open.

steps.title: Click Sensors.
steps.content: Click Sensors . If you don't see this tab, click ⋮ in the top-right corner of the developer window > More tools > Sensors .

steps.title: Click the "Location" drop-down menu.
steps.content: Click the "Location" drop-down menu. This is in the Sensors tab.

steps.title: Select a new location.
steps.content: Select a new location. You'll see a few presets here. To add another location, click Manage > Add location > enter GPS coordinates > Add .

steps.title: Enable your VPN.
steps.content: Enable your VPN. You can download a VPN application to your computer or add an extension to Google Chrome. Some popular VPN services include Proton VPN, NordVPN, and Norton VPN.

steps.title: Change your VPN location.
steps.content: Change your VPN location. Generally, you'll see this option in the VPN settings. You can usually set your VPN to a certain country's servers.

steps.title: Click ⋮.
steps.content: Click ⋮ . This is in the top-right corner of the Chrome window. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Click Settings.
steps.content: Click Settings . You can find this near the bottom of the drop-down menu.

steps.title: Click Privacy and security.
steps.content: Click Privacy and security . This is on the left side of the page.

steps.title: Click Site settings.
steps.content: Click Site settings . You can find this at the bottom.

steps.title: Click Location.
steps.content: Click Location . A new page will open.

steps.title: Select "Don't allow sites to see your location".
steps.content: Select "Don't allow sites to see your location". This is the second option. If you previously denied access to a website, you'll see it listed underneath Not allowed to see your location .
